intro: Otacanthus platychilus f. longifolius, commonly known as the long-leaved otacanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in moist forest understories. Its botanical features make it a unique subject for study in tropical botany.
